meanings.definition: To move or turn aside at an angle.
meanings.sent1: She was obliquing her path to avoid the puddle.
meanings.sent2: The car obliquing slightly to avoid the obstacle.
meanings.sent3: The cat was obliquing around the sleeping dog.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts obliquing towards a different solution.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's graceful obliquing across the stage mesmerized the audience.

meanings.definition: To deviate from a straight line or course.
meanings.sent1: The river obliquing around the bend.
meanings.sent2: The airplane obliquing slightly due to turbulence.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel obliquing its path to reach the acorn.
meanings.sent4: Her mind obliquing towards more creative ideas.
meanings.sent5: The road obliquing through the mountains offered breathtaking views.

meanings.sent1: He was obliquing his request to seem less demanding.
meanings.sent2: The fox obliquing towards the unsuspecting prey.
meanings.sent3: The child was obliquing his way to get extra cookies.
meanings.sent4: Her smile obliquing her true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The politician's speech was obliquing to gain more support.
